intro: Polyscias weinmanniae, commonly known as the Hawaiian sycamore, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that can grow up to 30 centimeters in diameter. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are followed by spherical berries containing several seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal forests and lowland areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in tropical gardens and greenhouses.
